title: Test project lookup
close_reason: Test bead, no longer needed

title: Phase 3: Test environment
description:
Implement optional per-worktree test environments with configurable hooks.

## Key Principle
Test environment is completely optional. wt works without any test_env config.

## Skill-Assisted Setup
The wt skill can:
- Ask user if they need a test environment for the worktree
- Detect project type (Node, Go, Python, etc.) and suggest appropriate setup
- Help generate setup/teardown scripts based on project needs

## Core Responsibilities (wt handles, when enabled)
- Port offset allocation and tracking
- Export PORT_OFFSET environment variable
- Call user-defined hooks if configured

## Configuration (.wt.toml)
```toml
[test_env]
enabled = true  # default: false
port_offset_base = 1000
port_offset_step = 100

# User-defined hooks (optional)
setup_cmd = "./scripts/test-setup.sh"
teardown_cmd = "./scripts/test-teardown.sh"
health_check_cmd = "./scripts/health-check.sh"
```

## Behavior (when test_env.enabled = true)
- On `wt new`: allocate port offset, set PORT_OFFSET, call setup_cmd if defined
- On `wt close/kill`: call teardown_cmd if defined, release port offset
- Health check: call health_check_cmd if defined, with configurable timeout/retries

## Design Principles
- Keep wt's role minimal - provide offset and call hooks
- Don't impose test env overhead on projects that don't need it
- Let skill handle interactive setup and smart suggestions
close_reason: Implemented optional test environment with port offset allocation, setup/teardown hooks, and health checks

description:
Implement core wt commands:
- wt / wt list: List all active sessions
- wt new <bead>: Spawn worker with namepool
- wt <name>: Switch to session
- wt kill <name>: Terminate session
- wt close <name>: Complete + cleanup

- Namepool management
- BEADS_DIR per session

title: Add wt events command with event logging
description:
Implement event logging for Claude Code integration.

Commands:
- wt events: show recent events
- wt events --tail: follow mode
- wt events --since 5m: filter by time
- wt events --new --clear: show new events and clear (for hooks)

Events logged to ~/.config/wt/events.log by:
- wt done (session completed)
- wt close (session closed)
- wt kill (session killed)
- PR status changes (if detected)

Event format (JSON lines):
{"time":"...","type":"session_ended","session":"pine","bead":"wt-661"}

Integration with Claude Code hooks:
- Add to prompt-submit hook to show new events in conversation
- Example: {"hooks":{"prompt-submit":["wt events --new --clear"]}}
close_reason: Implemented wt events command with --tail, --since, --new, --clear flags for Claude Code hook integration

title: Add wt auto command for autonomous batch processing
description:
Implement wt auto command that processes ready beads sequentially overnight.

## Flow
1. Acquire lock (~/.config/wt/auto.lock) - exit if already running
2. Get ready beads from bd ready (optional --project filter)
3. For each bead:
   - wt new <bead> --no-switch
   - Run configured claude command with prompt template
   - Wait for session to die or timeout
   - Merge based on --merge-mode flag
   - Log result to ~/.config/wt/logs/auto-<timestamp>.log
4. Check for stop signal between beads
5. Pick next ready bead, repeat until done
6. Release lock

## CLI Flags
- --project=<name>: filter to specific project
- --merge-mode=<direct|pr-review|pr-auto|none>: override project default
- --dry-run: show what would run without executing
- --check: validate beads are well-groomed before running
- --stop: signal running wt auto to stop after current bead
- --timeout=<minutes>: override per-bead timeout (default 30)

## Project Config (auto section)
```json
{
  "auto": {
    "command": "claude --dangerously-skip-permissions",
    "timeout_minutes": 30,
    "prompt_template": "Work on bead {BEAD_ID}: {TITLE}..."
  }
}
```

## Template Variables
{BEAD_ID}, {TITLE}, {DESCRIPTION}, {SESSION}, {PROJECT}, {WORKTREE}

## Stopping
- Ctrl+C: current session keeps running (orphaned)
- --stop flag or touch ~/.config/wt/stop-auto: graceful stop after current bead
- Resume: just run wt auto again, bd ready shows remaining work

## Lock File
- ~/.config/wt/auto.lock prevents multiple wt auto instances
- Contains: PID, start time, project filter
- --force to override (risky)

## Logging
- ~/.config/wt/logs/auto-<timestamp>.log
- Per-bead: start time, bead ID, outcome (success/fail/timeout), duration

Depends on wt-f3p (wt ready) and wt-661 (merge workflow).
close_reason: Implemented wt auto command with lock file, logging, dry-run, check, and stop signal handling

title: Search inside past session transcripts
description:
Allow searching through Claude conversation history:

wt seance --search 'auth bug fix'

Implementation options:
1. Locate Claude transcript files (~/.claude/projects/...)
2. Parse JSONL or markdown transcripts
3. Grep through content
4. Return matching sessions with context

Could also support:
- Semantic search (embeddings)
- Full-text indexing
- Preview of matching content

Bigger scope - investigate Claude Code transcript storage first.

title: Add handoff command for hub session persistence
description:
## Overview
Allow hub sessions to survive compaction and session restarts by implementing a handoff command that cycles to a fresh Claude instance while preserving work context.

## Inspiration
Based on gastown's handoff system (~/claude-tools/gastown/internal/cmd/handoff.go)

## Commands to Implement

### wt handoff
- `wt handoff` - Hand off with auto-collected context (ready beads, in-progress work)
- `wt handoff -m "notes"` - Include custom message/context
- `wt handoff -c` - Auto-collect state (ready beads, active sessions, etc.)

### wt prime
- Startup context injection command
- Detects post-handoff state and warns against re-running handoff
- Injects handoff content from previous session
- Integrates with Claude Code SessionStart hook

## Persistence Mechanisms

1. **Handoff Bead** (pinned)
   - Stores hub context in .beads/issues.jsonl
   - Title: "Hub Handoff" with status=pinned
   - Never auto-closed or compacted

2. **Handoff Marker** (.wt/handoff_marker)
   - Plain text file with previous session name
   - Written before respawn, removed by wt prime
   - Prevents handoff loop bug

## Implementation Flow

```
wt handoff -c
  ├─ Collect state (bd ready, wt list, in-progress beads)
  ├─ Update/create pinned handoff bead
  ├─ Write marker file
  ├─ Clear tmux history
  └─ tmux respawn-pane with fresh Claude

wt prime (on new session start)
  ├─ Check for handoff marker
  ├─ If found: output warning + inject handoff content
  ├─ Remove marker file
  └─ Run bd prime for beads context
```

## Files to Create/Modify

- cmd/wt/main.go - Add handoff and prime commands
- internal/handoff/handoff.go - Core handoff logic
- internal/handoff/prime.go - Startup context injection
- .claude/settings.json example - SessionStart hook config
close_reason: Implemented handoff and prime commands
